TextView.android:text: Hyundai sells over 500 Ioniq 5 EVs in India

Hyundai claims to have sold more than 500 units of the Ioniq 5 in India since its launch in January this year.
In India, the Ioniq 5 is available in a single, fully loaded variant priced at Rs 44.95 lakh (ex-showroom). The electric crossover is based on Hyundai's Electric-Global Modular Platform (E-GMP).
The Ioniq 5 features a futuristic design with angular surfaces on the exterior. It comes with dual LED headlamps, pixelated LED tail lights, flush-fitting door handles and unique dual-tone alloys. The EV gets a minimalistic interior with a dual floating screen and a 2-spoke steering wheel.
The Ioniq 5 is powered by a 72.6 kWh battery pack offering an ARAI-certified range of 631 km on a single charge. The car comes with a rear-mounted electric motor that makes 216 BHP and 350 Nm. It also supports 800V fast charging, which can charge the battery from 10-80% in 18 minutes.
